content.text: HTML - What is a Web API?
A Web API is a developer's dream.
content.html: A Web API is a developer's dream.

content.text: What is Web API?

API stands for A pplication P rogramming I nterface. An API is some kind of interface that includes a set of functions and subroutines that allow programmers to access specific features or data of an application, operating system or other services.
content.html: API stands for Application Programming Interface. An API is some kind of interface that includes a set of functions and subroutines that allow programmers to access specific features or data of an application, operating system or other services.

content.text: A Web API is an application programming interface for the Web.
content.html: A Web API is an application programming interface for the Web.

content.text: HTML APIs
All browsers have a set of built-in Web APIs to support complex operations, and to help accessing data.
content.html: All browsers have a set of built-in Web APIs to support complex operations, and to help accessing data.

content.text: Here are some of the main HTML5 APIs:
content.html: Here are some of the main HTML5 APIs:

content.text: 1. Geolocation API - This API is used to access the current location of a user (with latitude and longitude).
content.html: 1. Geolocation API - This API is used to access the current location of a user (with latitude and longitude).

content.text: 2. Drag and Drop API - This API enables you to use drag-and-drop features in browsers.
content.html: 2. Drag and Drop API - This API enables you to use drag-and-drop features in browsers.

content.text: 3. Web Storage API - This API has mechanisms to let browsers store key/value pairs (in a more intuitive way than cookies).
content.html: 3. Web Storage API - This API has mechanisms to let browsers store key/value pairs (in a more intuitive way than cookies).

content.text: 4. Web Workers API - This API allows a JavaScript to run in the background, without affecting the performance of the page. Users can continue to do whatever they want: clicking, selecting things, etc., while the web worker runs in the background.
content.html: 4. Web Workers API - This API allows a JavaScript to run in the background, without affecting the performance of the page. Users can continue to do whatever they want: clicking, selecting things, etc., while the web worker runs in the background.

content.text: 5. Server-Sent Events API - This API allows a web page to automatically get updates from a server.
content.html: 5. Server-Sent Events API - This API allows a web page to automatically get updates from a server.

content.text: 6. Canvas API - This API lets you draw graphics, on the fly, via JavaScript.
content.html: 6. Canvas API - This API lets you draw graphics, on the fly, via JavaScript.

content.text: Notes on Using HTML APIs
When implementing an HTML API, you should always:
content.html: When implementing an HTML API, you should always:

content.text: Check Browser Capability - Always check that the target browsers support the API. Always add script or message to be run if a browser does not support it.
content.html: Check Browser Capability - Always check that the target browsers support the API. Always add script or message to be run if a browser does not support it.

content.text: Add Robust Error Handling - Add robust error handling to take care of scenarios where an API may not function as expected, to ensure a seamless user experience.
content.html: Add Robust Error Handling - Add robust error handling to take care of scenarios where an API may not function as expected, to ensure a seamless user experience.

content.text: Request User Permission - When using an API that accesses sensitive data, like the Geolocation API (which will access the user's geographical position), always prompt the user for consent before proceeding.
content.html: Request User Permission - When using an API that accesses sensitive data, like the Geolocation API (which will access the user's geographical position), always prompt  the user for consent before proceeding.

content.text: Third Party APIs
Third party APIs are not built into your browser.
content.html: Third party APIs are not built into your browser.

content.text: To use these APIs, you will have to download the code from the Web.
content.html: To use these APIs, you will have to download the code from the Web.
